attributes.action: Create statutory policies for sexual violence complaints at all HEIs.
attributes.additional_details: Self-serving institutions are not listening. Their indifference to the safety of their students is evidenced by absent safeguarding policies, difficult reporting procedures, inadequate investigations, and toxic campus environments. Many of those who are responsible for supporting students have proven to be incompetent at best, and complicit at worst. The government must step in and demand change to address the inconsistencies in student safety and support across universities in the UK.
attributes.background: We are calling for a statutory procedures written by the government in partnership with survivors, advocates, and experts in sexual violence and abuse, that every university in the UK is mandated to follow when investigating complaints of sexual offences, with the addition of independent officers.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/588846
